page.title: 06Fernden Fencing
page.content: The fences are made of{sweet chestnut wood. They use that wood because it's easy to split into poles. The trees have to be{12 yrs old}before they are made into fences. The lowest fence is 1m and the highest is 2m. The fences are mostly used on building sites, parks and as temporary fencing. It{costs Â£1.65 a yard and Â£16.50 for 10 yards (9m). They used to have {transport}of their own but now they hire it to{deliver}the fences. They have 75mm spaces between the poles and they are held together with wire. They use a compressed-air staple-gun to fix the twisted wire to the wood. The people{sell}lots of fences in their area, and the nearest fence-maker to them is in Pembury. Now that more{conifers}are being planted close by, they need to get more of their wood from further away.
